page.title: 20ATTITUDES
page.content: There is a strong sense of community and a caring for others. The Wear Valley Council has an excellent 'Good Neighbour' scheme whereby someone is paid to visit pensioners on a regular basis, but actual neighbours are help- ful, especially in times of trouble. A luncheon club for pensioners in Ireshopeburn is run by volunteers, meals coming from the School Kitchen at Stanhope. Many organisations are capably run by local people. The creation of the Museum is an excellent illustration of local talents and cooperative effort. Congregations at the three churches are small but faithful.Anglicans and Methodists hold united services and support each other's fund raising efforts. There is an independence of spirit which has led many unemployed to set up their own businesses or work away from home.
